extends Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Argument(String name, Argument.Type dataType)
      The constructor takes in two parameters of String & Enumerator Type & depending on the type of enumerator being passed in it will set the value field to either false or null.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Argument

        public Argument(String name,
        Argument.Type dataType)
        The constructor takes in two parameters of String & Enumerator Type & depending on the type of enumerator being passed in it will set the value field to either false or null.
        Parameters:
        name - Sets the name field.
        dataType - Sets the type field.
        Throws:
        InvalidValueException - - Throws if the Boolean type is neither false or null.

      • getValue

        public <T> T getValue()
        Returns the value of the Object depending on its primitive type.
        Type Parameters:
        T - Returns a value of any type.
        Returns:
        Gives a value of either String,Int,Float,or Boolean.

      • setValue

        public void setValue(String newValue)
        Takes in a string value in order to properly set it to either an Int, Float, or Boolean and will default to a String if it contains anything else.
        Parameters:
        newValue - Sets the value field.
        Throws:
        NumberFormatException - - Throws if the Boolean value is neither true or false;
